channel.title: Gilnahirk Baptist Sermons
channel.description: Sermons preached at Gilnahirk Baptist Church, Belfast, N Ireland since 2006. Most of the sermons have been preached by our pastor, David Luke, but there are some by other church members and visiting speakers.
channel.copyright: Speakers/Gilnahirk Baptist Church, 2006-2008, but may distributed freely provided sermons are not edited and no charge is made

item.title: God's Inescapable Judgment (Revelation 20:11-15)
item.description:
Speaker: David Luke (pastor)
Series: Studies in Revelation (20)
Scripture: Revelation 20:11-15
Outline:
1) The Scene: a) universal; b) public; c) in accordance with our deeds; d) the signifiance of the Book of Life; e) judgment , not a trial; f) the judgment of judgment; and g) finality; and
2) Punishment: a) conscious; b) eternal; c) final (no return); and d) fire (a symbol of something worse).

item.title: True and Just Judgment (Rev 19)
item.description:
Speaker: David Luke (pastor)
Series: Studies in Revelation (18)
Scripture: Revelation 19
Outline:
A) 3 grounds on which God is to be praised:
1) the justice of his judgment;
2) the triumph of his reign; and
3) the completion of his redemption.
B) 2 key issues in Rev 19:
1) the clear division of humanity; and
2) the end is not in doubt.
David mentioned Robert Murray M'Cheyne at the start of his sermon. Andrew Bonar's classic biographical account of him is available from Project Gutenburg. The Memoir & Remains of Rev R. M. M'Cheyne by Andrew A. Bonar is published by Banner of Truth, Edinburgh. The sermon on Rev 19:3 that was mentioned can be read online. David Haslam has many useful resources about M'Cheyne on his Web site.

item.title: What a Life of Discipleship Involves (Luke 9:18-27)
item.description:
Speaker: David Luke (pastor)
Series: Following Jesus (2)
Scripture: Luke 9:18-27
Outline: Question 1) What happens next 2 challenges: a) recognize the cross as the centre of Christ's kingdom; and b) see the kingdom of God comes in no other way than through the cross of Christ. "When Christ calls a man he bids him come and die." (Dietrich Bonhoeffer) Question 2) What does a life of discipleship look like? 3 alternatives: a) saving face and losing our souls b) gaining the world and being eternally lost c) disowning Jesus and him disowning us Question 3) What does this mean for me? "He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose." (Jim Elliott).
item.itunes:subtitle: What a Life of Discipleship Involves (Luke 9:18-27)
item.itunes:summary:
Speaker: David Luke (pastor)

Scripture: Luke 9:18-27
Outline: Question 1) What happens next 2 challenges: a) recognize the cross as the centre of Christ's kingdom; and b) see the kingdom of God comes in no other way than through the cross of Christ. "When Christ calls a man he bids him come and die." (Dietrich Bonhoeffer) Question 2) What does a life of discipleship look like? 3 alternatives: a) saving face and losing our souls b) gaining the world and being eternally lost c) disowning Jesus and him disowning us Question 3) What does this mean for me? "He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose." (Jim Elliott).
